meanings.definition: A sudden loud noise or cry
meanings.sent1: The saul of the thunder startled the children.
meanings.sent2: The saul of the baby woke up the entire house.
meanings.sent3: The saul of the cat trying to catch a mouse was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The saul of the fireworks filled the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The saul of the alarm clock in the morning was jarring.

meanings.sent1: She would saul for help when she was in trouble.
meanings.sent2: The child would saul whenever he wanted attention.
meanings.sent3: He would saul with joy when he won a game.
meanings.sent4: The protesters would saul for justice in the streets.
meanings.sent5: The singer would saul with passion during her performances.

meanings.definition: A large wooden hammer for driving wedges or stakes
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a saul to drive the stake into the ground.
meanings.sent2: The farmer grabbed the saul to secure the fence post.
meanings.sent3: The saul was too heavy for the young boy to lift.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the saul hitting the wood echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent5: The old saul had been passed down through generations of woodworkers.
